newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian wool prices rise slightly in week.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian wool prices rise slightly in week.

text.p: The Australian wool market rose slightly at auction sales in Sydney, Adelaide and Fremantle this week, the Australian Council of Wool Exporters said.
The eastern market indicator rose two cents to 614 cents a kg clean, while, after a two week close, the western market indicator rose seven cents to 556 cents a kg clean.
The council said prices for 23 micron and finer Merino fleece wool rose by three to five cents a kg this week with some choice lots of 20 micron fleece returning extreme prices.
"A small group of buyers are continuing to compete strongly for 19.5 to 20.5 micron best to spinners style wool with staple strength of 35 newtons/kilotex or stronger," the council said.
After a meeting in Melbourne this week wool industry sectors reached a consensus regarding changes to stockpile disposal arrangements.
The majority agreed to recommend that the legislation governing stockpile disposal be modified to allow the sale of a minimum of 90,000 and a maximum of 250,000 bales per quarter.
Sales next week are in Sydney and Melbourne with 57,053 bales on offer. -- Sydney Newsroom 61-2 9373-1800
